info.description: Create and manage load balancers with DCOS Edge LB API
info.title: dcos_edge_lb

get.description: Get the entire configuration object including v1 and v2 pools.

200.description: A configuration object containing all load balancer pools.

get.description: Healthcheck endpoint.
Returns a v1 or v2 load balancer pool based on a single name.
Get the entire configuration.

200.description: A configuration object containing all load balancer pools.

put.description: Wipes and overwrites the entire configuration.

get.description: Get all load balancer pools.

200.description: An array of load balancer pools.

post.description: Creates a new load balancer pool.

get.description: Returns a load balancer pool based on a single name.

put.description: Updates a new load balancer pool.

delete.description: Deletes a single load balancer pool based on the name supplied.

get.description: Returns artifacts available for a load balancer pool.

200.description: List of artifacts for load balancer pool.

get.description: Returns an configuration artifact for a load balancer pool.

200.description: Configuration artifact for load balancer pool.

put.description: Creates or updates an configuration artifact for a load balancer pool. Not all artifacts can be changed.

200.description: Updated configuration artifact for load balancer pool.

delete.description: Clears an override for a artifact. Not all artifacts can be deleted.

200.description: Updated configuration artifact for load balancer pool.

get.description: Healthcheck endpoint.
Returns the installed Edge-LB package version.
Get the entire configuration object including only v2 pools.

200.description: A configuration object containing all v2 load balancer pools.

get.description: Returns the default lb config template.
Get all load balancer pools.

200.description: An array of load balancer pools.

post.description: Creates a new load balancer pool.

get.description: Returns a v2 load balancer pool based on a single name.

put.description: Updates a new load balancer pool.

delete.description: Deletes a single load balancer pool based on the name supplied.

get.description: Returns the rendered lb config for a pool.
Returns the lb config template for a pool.

put.description: Creates or updates the lb config template for a pool.

200.description: Updated lb config template for pool.

delete.description: Resets the lb config template to default for a pool.

200.description: Updated lb config template for pool.

get.description: Returns the ELB metadata for a pool.
List all pool templates.

delete.description: Delete a pool template and the pool generated by this pool template.

get.description: Get the status for each pool for a given pool template, e.g. rendering information.
Returns the pool configuration template for the pool template.

delete.description: Resets the pool configuration template to default

200.description: Updated pool configuration template for pool template.

get.description: Returns the installed Edge-LB package version.

ConfigContainer.description: Object used internally as an interface to handle multple model versions.

PoolContainer.description: Object used internally as an interface to handle multple model versions.

apiVersion.description: The api / schema version of this pool object

PoolTemplate.description: Specifies the configuration of a pool template

PoolTemplateStatus.description: Describes the status of the given pool template, e.g. rendering information

status.description: Describes the status of the rendering of the given pool template into a given pool

statuses.description: Describes the per task status of the rendering of the given pool template

status.description: Describes the status of the rendering of the given pool template into a given pool

balance.description: Load balancing strategy. e.g. roundrobin, leastconn, etc.

customCheck.description: This is used to specify alternate forms of healthchecks

miscStrs.description: Additional template lines inserted before servers

name.description: This is name that frontends refer to.

protocol.description: The backend protocol is how HAProxy communicates with the servers it's load balancing.

rewriteHttp.description: Manipulate HTTP headers. There is no effect unless the protocol is either HTTP or HTTPS.

servers.description: Array of backend network sources / selectors.

V1Config.description:
* If a default is not set, then it will be left empty, even for objects. * Set defaults in the object that is furthest from the root object. * Always set a default for arrays. * The purpose of "x-nullable" is to allow the output JSON field to be set
  to the golang "zero value". Without "x-nullable", the field will be
  removed altogether from the resulting JSON.
* Actual validation is done in the code, not expressed in swagger. * Since an empty boolean is interpreted as "false", don't set
  a default.
* CamelCase * Swagger will only do enum validation if it is a top level definition!

V1Frontend.description: The Frontend maps to the HAProxy frontend. This includes information such as what addresses and ports to listen on, what SSL/TLS certificates to use, and which backends to route to.

bindAddress.description: Only use characters that are allowed in the frontend name. Known invalid frontend name characters include "*", "[", and "]".

bindModifier.description: Additional text to put in the bind field

bindPort.description: The port (e.g. 80 for HTTP or 443 for HTTPS) that this frontend will bind to.

items.description:
SSL/TLS certificates in the load balancer.
For secrets, use "$SECRETS/my_file_name" For environment files, use "$ENVFILE/my_file_name" For autoCertificate, use "$AUTOCERT"

linkBackend.description: This describes what backends to send traffic to. This can be expressed with a variety of filters such as matching on the hostname or the HTTP URL path.

defaultBackend.description: This is default backend that is routed to if none of the other filters are matched.

map.description: This is an optional field that specifies a mapping to various backends. These rules are applied in order.

items.description: "backend" and at least one of the condition fields must be filled out. If multiple conditions are filled out they will be combined with a boolean "AND".

hostReg.description: All lowercase. It is possible for a port (e.g. "foo.com:80") to be in this regex!

miscStrs.description: Additional template lines inserted before use_backend

protocol.description: The frontend protocol is how clients/users communicate with HAProxy.

redirectToHttps.description: Setting this to the empty object is enough to redirect all traffic from HTTP (this frontend) to HTTPS (port 443).

except.description: One may additionally set a whitelist of fields that must be matched to allow HTTP.

items.description: Boolean AND will be applied with every selected value

V1Pool.description: The pool contains information on resources that the pool needs. Changes make to this section will relaunch the tasks.

apiVersion.description: The api / schema version of this pool object

autoCertificate.description:
Autogenerate a self-signed SSL/TLS certificate. It is not generated by default.
It will be written to "$AUTOCERT".

constraints.description: Marathon style constraints for load balancer instance placement.

count.description: Number of load balancer instances in the pool.

environmentVariables.description:
Environment variables to pass to tasks.
Prefix with "ELB_FILE_" and it will be written to a file. For example, the contents of "ELB_FILE_MYENV" will be written to "$ENVFILE/ELB_FILE_MYENV".

name.description:
The pool name. 
The name contains one or more lowercase letter(`a-z`), digit(`0-9`), or dash(`-`) and  must not begin or end with a dash(`-`). Ex. `my-pool-name`.

namespace.description:
The DC/OS space (sometimes also referred to as a "group").
The namespace consists of a series of names separated by slashes. See `name` for the description of valid names.

poolHealthcheckGracePeriod.description: Pool tasks healthcheck grace period (in seconds)

poolHealthcheckMaxFail.description: Pool tasks healthcheck maximum number of consecutive failures before declaring as unhealthy

poolHealthcheckTimeout.description: Maximum amount of time that Mesos will wait for the healthcheck container to finish executing

ports.description:
Override ports to allocate for each load balancer instance. Defaults to {{haproxy.frontend.objs[].bindPort}} and
  {{haproxy.stats.bindPort}}.
Use this field to pre-allocate all needed ports with or
  without the frontends present. For example: [80, 443, 9090].
If the length of the ports array is not zero, only the
  ports specified will be allocated by the pool scheduler.

role.description: Mesos role for load balancers. Defaults to "slave_public" so that load balancers will be run on public agents. Use "*" to run load balancers on private agents. Read more about Mesos roles at http://mesos.apache.org/documentation/latest/roles/

file.description:
File name.
The file "myfile" will be found at "$SECRETS/myfile"

type.description: The type of the pool, e.g. whether it is a dynamic one or static one

labels.description: Labels to pass to the virtual network plugin.

name.description: The name of the virtual network to join.

path.description: Rewrite the HTTP URL path. Adding a slash to fromPath usually is not necessary.

sticky.description:
Sticky sessions via a cookie.
To use the default values (recommended), set this field to the empty object.

V1RewriteHttpRequest.description:
Rewrite the request.
To use the default values (recommended), set this field to the empty object.

V1RewriteHttpResponse.description:
Rewrite the response.
To use the default values (recommended), set this field to the empty object.

check.description:
Enable health checks. These are by default TCP health checks. For more options see "customCheck".
These are required for DNS resolution (and hence VIPs) to function properly.

framework.description: The Mesos framework. If unsure, the value should probably be "marathon".

miscStr.description: Append arbitrary string to the "server" directive.

value.description: The Task name. This field is not needed for VIPs. For Marathon pods this is the container name NOT the pod name.

all.description:
For AUTO_IP, AGENT_IP and CONTAINER_IP this can be used to expose all defined ports.
This should only be used if a name is not defined for the port and there is a single port defined for the service.

name.description: The name of the port. This is used for AUTO_IP, AGENT_IP and CONTAINER_IP.

V1ServerType.description:
AUTO_IP detects between AGENT_IP and CONTAINER_IP and uses the appropriate value.
AGENT_IP is for HOST and BRIDGE networking. VIP for l4lb service addresses. CONTAINER_IP is for virtual networks. This is not DNS.

balance.description: Load balancing strategy. e.g. roundrobin, leastconn, etc.

customCheck.description: This is used to specify alternate forms of healthchecks

miscStrs.description: Additional template lines inserted before servers

name.description: This is name that frontends refer to.

protocol.description: The backend protocol is how HAProxy communicates with the servers it's load balancing.

rewriteHttp.description: Manipulate HTTP headers. There is no effect unless the protocol is either HTTP or HTTPS.

accessLogS3Location.description: Location of the access logs of a load balancer, with format `S3Bucket/prefix`, if you dont specify a prefix, the access logs are stored in the root of the bucket. Access logs are created only if the load balancer has a TLS listener and they contain information only about TLS requests.

arn.description: ARN of the ELB to use. If it is specified, it is assumed that there is a pre-created ELB that Edge-LB is not supposed to create or delete.

deletionProtection.description: If true, the load balancer will not be deleted when the corresponding pool is deleted.

elasticIPs.description: Elastic IP addresses (IPv4 addresses and allocation IDs) that should be associated with subnets, the ELB is attached to. For instance, ["1.1.1.1", "eip-12345678"]

internal.description: If true (default), a load balancer is created as internal; otherwise - as internet-facing.

name.description: Name of the ELB which should be unique within an Edge-LB pool. The actual ELB name would be derived from this name and would be of form dcos-lb-hash(cluster-id)-hash(edgelb-app-id)-hash(pool-name)-hash(elb-name).

subnets.description: IDs of subnets to attach the ELB to. If it is empty, subnets are autodiscovered based on Edge-LB load balancers registered with apiserver.

elasticIP.description: Elastic IP address which the ELB is attached to in a specified availability zone.

name.description: The name of the availability zone.

linkFrontend.description: An Edge-LB frontend to proxy requests to.

V2CloudProviderAwsElbListenerTls.description: A TLS configuration of AWS ELB listener.

certificates.description: SSL server certificates referenced using ARNs.

reason.description: The reason explaining the current load balancer status.

status.description: The status of a load balancer.

availabilityZones.description: The availability zones in which load balancer nodes locate.

state.description: The state of the load balancer.

V2CloudProviderAwsStatus.description: An array of AWS ELB statuses.

V2CloudProviderAwsTag.description: A named tag with an associated value.

V2Config.description:
* If a default is not set, then it will be left empty, even for objects. * Set defaults in the object that is furthest from the root object. * Always set a default for arrays. * The purpose of "x-nullable" is to allow the output JSON field to be set
  to the golang "zero value". Without "x-nullable", the field will be
  removed altogether from the resulting JSON.
* Actual validation is done in the code, not expressed in swagger. * Since an empty boolean is interpreted as "false", don't set
  a default.
* CamelCase * Swagger will only do enum validation if it is a top level definition!

address.description: Server address override, can be used to specify a cluster internal address such as a VIP.

check.description: Enable health checks. These are by default TCP health checks. For more options see "customCheck". These are required for DNS resolution to function properly.

miscStr.description: Append arbitrary string to add to the end of the "server" directive.

V2Frontend.description: The Frontend maps to the HAProxy frontend. This includes information such as what addresses and ports to listen on, what SSL/TLS certificates to use, and which backends to route to.

bindAddress.description: Only use characters that are allowed in the frontend name. Known invalid frontend name characters include "*", "[", and "]".

bindModifier.description: Additional text to put in the bind field

bindPort.description: The port (e.g. 80 for HTTP or 443 for HTTPS) that this frontend will bind to.

items.description:
SSL/TLS certificates in the load balancer.
For secrets, use "$SECRETS/my_file_name" For environment files, use "$ENVFILE/my_file_name" For autoCertificate, use "$AUTOCERT"

linkBackend.description: This describes what backends to send traffic to. This can be expressed with a variety of filters such as matching on the hostname or the HTTP URL path.

defaultBackend.description: This is default backend that is routed to if none of the other filters are matched.

map.description: This is an optional field that specifies a mapping to various backends. These rules are applied in order.

items.description: "backend" and at least one of the condition fields must be filled out. If multiple conditions are filled out they will be combined with a boolean "AND".

hostReg.description: All lowercase. It is possible for a port (e.g. "foo.com:80") to be in this regex!

miscStrs.description: Additional template lines inserted before use_backend

protocol.description: The frontend protocol is how clients/users communicate with HAProxy.

redirectToHttps.description: Setting this to the empty object is enough to redirect all traffic from HTTP (this frontend) to HTTPS (port 443).

except.description: One may additionally set a whitelist of fields that must be matched to allow HTTP.

items.description: Boolean AND will be applied with every selected value

V2Pool.description: The pool contains information on resources that the pool needs. Changes make to this section will relaunch the tasks.

apiVersion.description: The api / schema version of this pool object

autoCertificate.description:
Autogenerate a self-signed SSL/TLS certificate. It is not generated by default.
It will be written to "$AUTOCERT".

constraints.description: Marathon style constraints for load balancer instance placement.

count.description: Number of load balancer instances in the pool.

environmentVariables.description:
Environment variables to pass to tasks.
Prefix with "ELB_FILE_" and it will be written to a file. For example, the contents of "ELB_FILE_MYENV" will be written to "$ENVFILE/ELB_FILE_MYENV".

name.description:
The pool name. 
The name contains one or more lowercase letter(`a-z`), digit(`0-9`), or dash(`-`) and  must not begin or end with a dash(`-`). Ex. `my-pool-name`.

namespace.description:
The DC/OS space (sometimes also referred to as a "group").
The namespace consists of a series of names separated by slashes. See `name` for the description of valid names. By default, Edge-lB pool shares the same namespace as APIServer

poolHealthcheckGracePeriod.description: Pool tasks healthcheck grace period (in seconds)

poolHealthcheckMaxFail.description: Pool tasks healthcheck maximum number of consecutive failures before declaring as unhealthy

poolHealthcheckTimeout.description: Maximum amount of time that Mesos will wait for the healthcheck container to finish executing

ports.description:
Override ports to allocate for each load balancer instance. Defaults to {{haproxy.frontends[].bindPort}} and
  {{haproxy.stats.bindPort}}.
Use this field to pre-allocate all needed ports with or
  without the frontends present. For example: [80, 443, 9090].
If the length of the ports array is not zero, only the
  ports specified will be allocated by the pool scheduler.

principal.description: Mesos principal for pool framework authentication. If omitted or left blank, the service account used to install Edge-LB will be used if present.

role.description: Mesos role for load balancers. Defaults to "slave_public" so that load balancers will be run on public agents. Use "*" to run load balancers on private agents. Read more about Mesos roles at http://mesos.apache.org/documentation/latest/roles/

secretName.description: Service account secret name for pool framework authentication. If omitted or left blank, the service account used to install Edge-LB will be used if present.

file.description:
File name.
The file "myfile" will be found at "$SECRETS/myfile"

type.description: The type of the pool, e.g. whether it is a dynamic one or static one

labels.description: Labels to pass to the virtual network plugin.

name.description: The name of the virtual network to join.

endpoints.description: Array of public, private IP addresses and port. Each entry in the array reflects the endpoint information of a particular pool instance. For example, if there are three pool instances then there would be three entries in the endpoint array.

name.description: Name of the frontend in the edge-lb pool.

path.description: Rewrite the HTTP URL path. Adding a slash to fromPath usually is not necessary.

sticky.description:
Sticky sessions via a cookie.
To use the default values (recommended), set this field to the empty object.

V2RewriteHttpRequest.description:
Rewrite the request.
To use the default values (recommended), set this field to the empty object.

V2RewriteHttpResponse.description:
Rewrite the response.
To use the default values (recommended), set this field to the empty object.

containerName.description: Marathon pod container name, optional unless using Marathon pods.
